block.p: Boris Becker and John McEnroe scored strong victories yesterday and will play each other in the semifinals of the ABN-AMRO indoor tournament in Rotterdam, the Netherlands. Aleksandr Volkov of Russia and Paul Haarhuis of the Netherlands will play in the other semifinal today. Becker beat Patrick McEnroe, 6-3, 7-5. John McEnroe beat Alex Antonitsch of Austria, 2-6, 6-3, 7-5. Antonitsch saved three match points before McEnroe finally won. (AP) TRACK AND FIELD O'Brien Sets Record Dan O'Brien set a world record with 4,497 points and tied meet marks in the high jump and 60-meter high hurdles at the TAC-USA men's indoor pentathlon championships in Moscow, Idaho. O'Brien swept all five events. He ran the high hurdles in 7.88 seconds. He long jumped 24 feet 1 1/2 inches, threw the shot-put 48-2 1/2, high jumped 7 1/2 and ran the 1,000 meters in 2:40.12. (AP) Berezhnaya Wins: Larisa Berezhnaya of Ukraine, the 1991 world indoor champion, won the women's long jump at the European championships. GOLF Coe Ahead by a Stroke Dawn Coe, seeking her first victory in nine years on the L.P.G.A. Tour, birdied the final two holes and took a one-stroke lead after three rounds of the Women's Kemper Open in Wailea, Hawaii. Coe, who started the day in a six-way tie for first place, shot 69 on the par-72 course. She was at nine-under-par 207 entering the final round today. (AP) U.S. Team Takes Lead: Lee Trevino and Chi Chi Rodriguez combined for a 64, helping the United States take a 15-5 lead over the International team in the first round of the Chrysler Cup in Sarasota, Fla. The Americans won three of the four best-ball stroke-play matches, with each victory worth five points in the team standing. Trevino and Rodriguez beat Gary Player and Bob Charles, who shot a 67 in the three-day event for top senior golfers. (AP) BOXING Lopez, 39, Knocked Out Danny (Little Red) Lopez, away from the ring for a dozen years, was knocked out 37 seconds into the second round Thursday night by Jorge Rodriguez in a scheduled 10-round junior lightweight bout in Irvine, Calif. The 39-year-old Lopez retired in 1980 after being knocked down by Salvador Sanchez in consecutive fights. (AP)
